Posts.Content: c1reid wrote: Hi, ive spent all morning reading posts looking for answers. I had cervical cancer last year. I had a radial hysterectomy followed by 6 weeks of chemo and internal radiation. A few months ago i found a lump in my right breast which when i pressed on, discharged yellow sticky fluid from nipple.Cut a long story short,rather than waiting to see my gp as it was the weekend i went to emergancy clinic where a nurse examined me and said she didnt feel anything (i felt rather stupid) i got her to take a sample of the discharge and that was it. I figured as she said she couldnt feel it and i didnt hear back from the swab results not to worry. However the other night in bed i brushed against my breast and it had gotten bigger,now discharging a brown sticky liquid when pressed.Went to my gp straight away who didnt sugarcoat anything and told me he wasnt going to lie,he thinks its suspicious and now im waiting on a appointment for my referral to the breast cancer clinic....what happens now? Im scared, im angry with myself for not going about it sooner but im a year in remission,i didnt think id be that unlucky and tbh i want to run away from this rther than face it. Is there any other cancer survivors who have went onto have bc? Is there a link? Â Im trying to think positive but i cant think it will be anything other than cancer. My cc was stage 1B but graded 3, no lymph node involvement but as it was aggressive thats why i had furthur treatment. please someone help me. Im crying now, id just had my baby when diagnosed before,he's nearly 2 now,i have my daughter at 8,i dont want to go through this again Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: one year cc survivor now have lump and discharge in breast c1reid SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2011 03:36AM c1reid wrote: thank you for posting, its so easy to let fear take over and convince yourself its cancer and not something else.Think the doctor scared me too as he was so upfront which i appreciate.Taking a deep breath and going to try not think about it, thank you
Posts.Title: one year cc survivor now have lump and discharge in breast c1reid SarahsMom
